object-type.name: Group
object-type.inject-documentation: This is an abstract class, it is derived by 2 different classes: :doc:`App` which represents an instance of Natron, or more specifically an opened project. :doc:`Effect` which represents a node in the nodegraph.

modify-function.inject-code: %RETURN_TYPE %0 = %CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME(%1,%2,%3, %4); %PYARG_0 = %CONVERTTOPYTHON[%RETURN_TYPE](%0);
%RETURN_TYPE %0 = %CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME(%1,%2, %3); %PYARG_0 = %CONVERTTOPYTHON[%RETURN_TYPE](%0);
%RETURN_TYPE %0 = %CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME(%1,%2, %3); %PYARG_0 = %CONVERTTOPYTHON[%RETURN_TYPE](%0);
%RETURN_TYPE %0 = %CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME(%1); %PYARG_0 = %CONVERTTOPYTHON[%RETURN_TYPE](%0);
%RETURN_TYPE %0 = %CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME(); %PYARG_0 = %CONVERTTOPYTHON[%RETURN_TYPE](%0);
%CPPSELF.%FUNCTION_NAME();

object-type.name: Effect
object-type.inject-documentation: This object represents a single node in Natron, that is, an instance of a plug-in. You cannot create Effects directly by calling their constructor, instead you must use the function :doc:`App.createNode` to create them.

modify-function.inject-documentation: Returns the node at the given input.
Returns the node at the given input.
